dict.string: In this program, you are going to learn about a few key systems and applications, and we are going to ensure that your accounts are secure.

• Setup MFA on your JumpCloud account • Sign into Google Chrome to sync your profile and access cool stuff • Setup 2FA on your Google account • Sign into OpenVPN and setup 2FA to access key resources • Sign into Slack, and learn about some fun channels to join
How does IT onboarding work with this super cool application we're using?

On the right hand side of the training "window" is a "checklist" of all the "to-do's" (mentioned on the previous page) you must accomplish to complete the IT onboarding process.
When you reach the end of a training "segment" you will be asked to acknowledge completion of the "segment" by clicking an "I Agree" checkbox. That checkbox will activate completion of the segment, and create a green checkmark next to the "to-do" item. Once all "to-do" items have been completed you will be able to complete the training (close the application window).
Use the "Next" button in the lower right hand corner to navigate sequentially through all the training segments. The "Previous" button can be used at any time to go back through segments.
Your JumpCloud username and password will be your login for most everything at Foursquare. JumpCloud can provide access to the following applications, systems, and much much more:
• DataBricks • Box • Asana • AWS Console • Office WiFi • bswift • Carrot • Lattice • Expensify • Microsoft 365
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
Foursquare requires every JumpCloud user to have their account protected by Multi-Factor Authentication. In Segment One we are going to setup Multi-Factor Authentication on your account.
Click the “Next” button below to open Google Chrome to the JumpCloud user console login.
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
Log into JumpCloud using your Foursquare email address and password.
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
In the upper left hand corner of your account page, select "Security".
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
On the "Security" settings page, find the "Multi-Factor Authentication" section, and click the "Set Up TOTP" button.
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
Multi-Factor Authentication requires a qualified authentication app such as Google Authenticator
Please download Google Authenticator on your mobile device from Google Play or App Store. On the next window, click the "Continue" button.
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account
Using the Authenticator app from your phone, click "Begin Setup" and scan the QR code on the "Set Up TOTP MFA" page.
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account

Enter the six digit code from the Authenticator app next to the QR code. (If a prompt appears suggesting you use the app, please select the option that indicates you do not see it. You should then be able to continue as normal)
Segment One - Setup JumpCloud MFA on your account

You've successfully setup Multi-Factor Authentication on your JumpCloud account! You are now ready to move onto the next segment of onboarding. Before you do, we need you to acknowledge that you have setup Multi-Factor Authentication on your account:

array.string: By checking this box, I ${USER_FULL_NAME} acknowledge:

dict.string: Please acknowledge that you've completed this section.
I have activated Multi-Factor Authentication on my JumpCloud account, and hereby will be subject to account suspension and denied access to services if MFA is not active on my account.
Next: Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
Signing into Google Chrome has 3 main benefits at Foursquare:

1. Helps keep your browsing data, history, and personalization safe and secure
2. In the event you need a new computer, signing in reloads all of your personalizations, history, data, and bookmarks; simply pick back up from where you left off!
3. Signing in enables access to the Foursquare Chrome Extension
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
Let's set Google Chrome as your default browser by clicking the Use "Chrome" button.
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
In Google Chrome, locate the "User" icon in the upper right hand corner, and click it:
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
In the resulting window, click the "Turn on sync..." button:
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
In the resulting window, sign in with your Foursquare email address and JumpCloud password:
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
After signing in, a dialog box will appear asking you to "Link your data?". Click the "Link Data" button to continue:
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
Another dialog box will appear and ask "Turn on sync?". Click the "Yes, I'm in" button to continue:
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
After you've finished setting up sync and signing in, you'll notice a Foursquare logo up in the upper right hand corner next to your profile picture. This is the Foursquare Chrome Extension.
1Password setup will be covered in your Foursquare Security Training.
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome

The Foursquare Chrome Extension is your information and support "hub". The extension allows you to navigate to other department's help sections and allows for the submission of "help" tickets to those same departments. Feel free to click around and explore the extension!
Segment Two - Sign into Google Chrome
You've successfully signed into Google Chrome! You are now ready to move onto the next segment of onboarding. Before you do, we need you to acknowledge that you have signed into Google Chrome:

array.string: By checking this box, I ${USER_FULL_NAME} acknowledge:

dict.string: Please acknowledge that you've completed this section.

I have signed into Google Chrome and am ready to experience all the awesomeness syncing has to offer, and will use the Foursquare Chrome Extension as much as humanly possible to retrieve information about Foursquare and submit tickets to other departments, when needed.
Next: Segment Three - Setup 2-Step Verification on your Google Account
Google Workspace is Foursquare's email, calendar, and document storage provider... and much much more!
In order to use Google Workspace for Foursquare, we need you to turn on 2-Step Verification for your Foursquare Google Workspace account.
Segment Three - Setup 2-Step Verification on your Google Account
2-Step Verification adds an extra layer of security to your Foursquare Google Workspace account, and is mandatory for every Foursquare employee.
You will need your mobile phone to receive a text message to enable 2-Step Verification for your Foursquare Google Workspace account.
Click “Next” to be directed in Google Chrome to log into your Google account settings page; the settings page is where you can setup 2-Step Verification.
Segment Three - Setup 2-Step Verification on your Google Account
On your Google account page, locate the "Security" tab in the navigation panel and select it:
Segment Three - Setup 2-Step Verification on your Google Account

On the resulting "Security" page, locate the "Signing in to Google" section (mid way down the page), and select 2-Step Verification. On the following page, select "GET STARTED" and follow the prompts to complete your 2-Step Verification setup:
Segment Three - Setup 2-Step Verification on your Google Account

You've successfully activated 2-Step Verification for your Foursquare Google Workspace account! You are now ready to move onto the next segment of onboarding. Before you do, we need you to acknowledge that you have activated 2-Step Verification:

array.string: By checking this box, I ${USER_FULL_NAME} acknowledge:

dict.string: Please acknowledge that you've completed this section.
I have activated 2-Step Verification for my Foursquare Google Workspace account, and am subject to a denial of Google services if it is later discovered that 2-Step is not active on my account.
Next: Learn how Foursquare uses Google Workspaces
OpenVPN is your access to Foursquare Data Centers, AWS, and much much more! Learn how to setup 2-step verification for Dr. Tortas and use the OpenVPN Connect client.
To get started, click the "Next" button below to open Google Chrome to our VPN setup webpage (drtacos.foursquare.com).
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
Log into Dr. Tortas using your JumpCloud user "shortname" (everything before "@foursquare.com" in your email address) in the "username" field, and JumpCloud password:
(example JumpCloud shortname: mmeyer@foursquare.com is "mmeyer", or tuser@foursquare.com is "tuser")
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
Using your authenticator app, scan the QR code to setup 2-Step Verification (which is required for VPN access, in addition to your JumpCloud user shortname and JumpCloud password):
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup

After you've successfully scanned the QR code, enter the code from your authenticator app, specifically for OpenVPN, at the bottom of the page and click “Confirm Code” (VERY IMPORTANT). After you click the button, you may close Google Chrome:
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
In the resulting OpenVPN Connect window enter drtortas.foursquare.com as the URL and click NEXT.
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
Enter your JumpCloud user "shortname" (everything before "@foursquare.com" in your email address) in the "username" field, and JumpCloud password. Then click "IMPORT."
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup

After using your JumpCloud user shortname and JumpCloud password, a prompt for Multi-factor authentication appears. Enter the code from your authenticator app, specifically for OpenVPN. Then click "SEND."
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
Click on the OpenVPN app in the menu bar and select "Connect" in the contextual menu:
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
Enter your JumpCloud password and select "OK."
Then, enter the code from your authenticator app, specifically for OpenVPN, and select "SEND."
Segment Four - OpenVPN installation and setup
You've successfully setup and signed into OpenVPN! You are almost done with IT Onboarding. Before you finish, we need you to acknowledge that you have setup and signed into OpenVPN:

array.string: By checking this box, I ${USER_FULL_NAME} acknowledge:

dict.string: Please acknowledge that you've completed this section.

I have setup and signed into OpenVPN. OpenVPN is only to be used on Foursquare company-owned assets/hardware. OpenVPN is used to connect to various "mission critical" production/internal systems, and should be used with great care.
Next: Segment Five - Sign into Slack

Foursquare uses Slack as a supplemental communication tool accross the entire company. Slack allows employees to chat 1:1 with other employees, create and participate in team channels, and participate in other fun channels. Foursquare Slack has a wide selection of group chat channels for employees with different interests. A few noteworthy channels to check out: "#announcements", "#helpdesk", and "#dogs". Click the "Next" button to launch Slack, and sign in:
(As a good rule of thumb, be careful of using @here or @channel. Everyone in the channel will receive a notification when those tags are used!)
In the open Slack app, click the green "Sign In to Slack" button to start the sign in process:
A new webpage will open, and you will be asked to sign in. Use the "Sign in with Google" button:
On the following page, sign in with your Foursquare Google account email address and JumpCloud password, using 2-Step Verification when asked:
After signing in, select the checkbox next to the Foursquare workspace, and then click the "Open" button:
On the next page, select your signed in Foursquare account to complete sign in:
After selecting your Google account, the system will ask you to open the Slack app, select "Open Slack":
You've successfully signed into Slack! You are now ready to move onto the next segment of onboarding. Before you do, we need you to acknowledge that you have signed into Slack:

array.string: By checking this box, I ${USER_FULL_NAME} acknowledge:

dict.string: Please acknowledge that you've completed this section.

I have signed into Slack and am ready to explore, participate, and embrace fun channels such as "#good-band-names", "#bad-band-names", "#dogs", "#code", and "#cats" and will learn how to use daibot and "++"'s responsibly and ethically
Click the "Next" button for some "Final Steps"...
Great job ${USER_FIRST_NAME}, you've completed IT Onboarding!

We hope you've learned a few things along the way, and if you have any questions or comments afterwards, feel free to reach to us at "http://go.foursquare.com/helpdesk" or come find us in the "#helpdesk" channel on Slack. We'd love to hear what you thought about this onboarding experience! Have a great rest of your first day at Foursquare!
Click the "Finish" button to close IT Onboarding
Please complete all of the necessary on-boarding tasks and agree to completion by checking the "I Agree" boxes in each section.
